title: Pilot
description: Debra doesn't want Raymond's family to barge in unannounced from across the street on her birthday, so it's up to Raymond to gently break the news to them.

title: I Love You
description: Ray can't say "I love you" to Debra, and he traces the source of his problem back to his parents.

title: I Wish I Were Gus
description: Ray has to deliver the eulogy at his Uncle Gus's funeral, but he spends more time at the funeral trying to settle a dispute between Marie and her sister.

title: Standard Deviation
description: The results of an I.Q. Ray and Debra take for Robert's police training create a lot of tension, but Robert may have the last laugh on both of them.

title: Look Don't Touch
description: Debra gets upset with Ray after he sticks his foot in his mouth regarding a sexy new waitress at Nemos.

title: Frank, the Writer
description: Frank believes that he has become a professional writer after a joke he submitted gets published in "Reader's Digest."

title: Your Place or Mine?
description: Marie stays at Raymond and Debra's house after she gets in a fight with Frank. Meanwhile, Frank has the time of his life by himself at home, and Raymond starts getting used to having his mom spoil him again.

title: In-Laws
description: Debra's parents invite all of the Barones to a night out at a fancy French restaurant. While they're there, Raymond makes an inappropriate comment that gets him in trouble with both families.

title: Win, Lose or Draw
description: Raymond loses $2300 to Frank in a poker game, and Frank refuses Marie's demands to give the money back.

title: Turkey or Fish
description: Debra tries to start her own tradition by hosting a Thanksgiving fish dinner for both families, but Marie threatens to ruin everything by coming with turkey.

title: Captain Nemo
description: Robert is named captain of the Nemo's basketball team, and Raymond is jealous. But when Robert becomes a tyrant, the team turns on him. Robert quits the team, and Raymond becomes captain, which causes tension at home.

title: The Ball
description: Ray is so shattered when he discovers that the autographed Mickey Mantle baseball his father gave him as a child is a fake, that he wants to tell Ally that there is no Santa Claus.

title: Debra's Sick
description: Raymond misses an interview with Terry Bradshaw about ghostwriting his book because he has to take Ally and Michael to the pediatrician. Debra is sick at home, and Marie comes over to take care of her.

title: Who's Handsome?
description: Robert goes out on a first date with Debra's friend Amy, and Raymond suddenly become insecure about his looks when everybody starts saying that Robert is more handsome than him.

title: The Car
description: Debra finds out that the reason why Raymond made them buy Frank and Marie's old car is because he doesn't want to get rid of the car that he used to get lucky in.

title: Diamonds
description: Raymond tries to replace Debra's engagement ring behind her back after he finds out that it's counterfeit. But why is Debra so upset when she discovers that Raymond has made the switch?

title: The Game
description: Raymond and Debra "enjoy" a game of Scruples with Marie, Frank, and Robert after the cable signal goes out for the evening.

title: Recovering Pessimist
description: Debra confronts Raymond about his pessimism after he takes no joy in winning the Sportswriter of the Year award.

title: The Dog
description: Ray wants to keep a lovable bulldog he found in the neighborhood, but at Debra's request he reluctantly gives the dog away to Robert. However, after he has already given him away, the dog's rightful owner shows up to claim him.

title: Neighbors
description: Raymond's neighbors come over to voice their numerous complaints about his parents, and Frank and Marie walk in on them. Raymond now feels humiliated and guilty of betraying his parents.

title: Fascinatin' Debra
description: A radio psychologist comes to interview Debra for a book, but she winds up being more interested in Raymond and his family. Therefore, Debra comes to the conclusion that she is too boring.

title: Why Are We Here?
description: Flashback to when Ray and Debra first moved across the street from Marie and Frank.

title: Ray's on TV
description: All the Barones critique Ray's substitute performance on TV.

title: Father Knows Least
description: Ally is disobeying Ray and Debra. Not doing what she's told to do. Always in a bad mood. Ray tries to find out why.

title: Brother
description: Robert is depressed because it's the anniversary of his divorce. Marie and Frank try to get Ray take Robert to movie or something. Just to cheer him up.

title: Mozart
description: After three lessons, Ally is bored of the piano. Ray doesn't want her to lose interest so quickly, so he asks Marie to teach him the piano again.

title: Golf
description: Ray has an anxiety attack while golfing. The doctor suggests more golf to help calm Ray down. Debra won't like that.

title: Anniversary
description: On their fortieth anniversary, Marie and Frank tell Ray that they almost got divorced once.

title: Working Late Again
description: Ray tells Debra that he's going to be working late. But is he really?

title: The Children's Book
description: Ray and Debra have a face-off of "Who can make the best children's book?", with Ally as the judge.

title: The Gift
description: Ray gets Frank a fish tank for his 65th birthday.

title: High School
description: Ray and Debra go to Ray's 20th High School Reunion.

title: The Letter
description: Marie has finally pushed Debra to her limit. Debra sends her a letter telling how she really feels about her.

title: All I Want for Christmas
description: Ray tries to have sex with Debra.

title: Civil War
description: Frank and his pals are reenacting the Civil War and Ray wants to help.

title: Mia Famiglia
description: Ray tries to find his oldest living relative.

title: Marie's Meatballs
description: Debra tries to learn how to make Marie's famous meatballs.

title: The Checkbook
description: Raymond questions Debra about the budget and says he can do a better job - so she lets him try. In a few weeks, Ray bounces checks and has $300 in overdraft fees. He creates a fake checkbook so it all looks good on paper.

title: The Ride-Along
description: After Ray teases Robert about his police work being somewhat easygoing, Robert invites him on a citizen's ride-along; but Ray gets more than he bargained for, leading him to view Robert in a new light.

title: The Family Bed
description: Ray and Debra can't get a good night's sleep after Ally starts sleeping in their bed.

title: Good Girls
description: Ray finds out the Marie likes Amy more than Debra because Amy is a "good" girl.

title: T-Ball
description: Allie starts on a T-Ball team and it's Debra's turn to bring the snacks. She brings something that is not on the approved food list and refuses to change it to something else. Ray wants to comply and she does not.

title: Traffic School
description: Robert practices his traffic teaching skills on the family.

title: Six Feet Under
description: Ray has a mid-life crises when he finds out he's not six feet tall anymore.

title: The Garage Sale
description: Marie and Frank have a yard sale. But Ray doesn't want to sell the baby stuff.

title: The Wedding: Part 1
description: Flashback to when Ray proposed to Debra.

title: The Wedding: Part 2
description: Flashback to Ray and Debra's wedding.

title: The Invasion
description: When Ray's house gets termites, Marie invites them all to stay across the street until the house is clean.

title: Driving Frank
description: Debra is growing uneasy with Frank's driving and wants Frank to take another Driving Test.

title: The Sitter
description: Ray and Debra hire the perfect babysitter.

title: Getting Even
description: When Ray embarrasses Debra at a Bidding, Debra says she's going to get him back for it. Ray wonders how.

title: The Visit
description: Debra's mother comes for a visit. But she isn't very helpful.

title: Halloween Candy
description: Ray plans an evening of sex on Halloween.

title: Moving Out
description: Robert moves out of Marie and Frank's house.

title: The Article
description: Ray becomes jealous when Andy's article gets published in "Sports Illustrated".

title: The Lone Barone
description: Robert breaks up with Amy.

title: No Fat
description: Marie plans a healthy Thanksgiving to help with her cholesterol.

title: The Apartment
description: Robert's new apartment has beautiful women all over the place. Ray can't stay away.

title: The Toaster
description: When Ray gives his parents an engraved toaster for Christmas, they exchange it right away without even opening it.

title: Ping Pong
description: When Ray finds out that Frank used to let him win at Ping Pong as a kid, he challenges Frank to a rematch.

title: Pants on Fire
description: Ray tells the story of how he used to throw parties as a teenager when Marie and Frank were gone. Marie goes berserk.

title: Robert's Date
description: Judy takes Robert out dancing. Everyone else thinks they're dating.

title: Frank's Tribute
description: Ray and Robert make a tribute to Frank for his "Man of the Month" party at the lodge.

title: Cruising with Marie
description: When Frank breaks his leg, Ray replaces him on a cruise with Marie.

title: Ray Home Alone
description: When Debra and the kids go away for the weekend, Ray's afraid to stay alone.

title: Big Shots
description: Ray and Robert think they're big shots because of their jobs.

title: Move Over
description: Debra hogs the bed at night.

title: The Getaway
description: Ray and Debra go away to a bed-and-breakfast.

title: Working Girl
description: Debra gets a job as a copywriter.

title: Be Nice
description: Ray and Debra try to be nice to each other.

title: Dancing with Debra
description: Robert and Debra go out dancing for fun. But Ray thinks it's something more.

title: Robert Moves Back
description: When Robert and Amy have sex, they forget to close the curtains and are seen by everyone. When Robert finds out, he hides out at Ray's.

title: How They Met
description: Flashback to how Ray and Debra met.

title: Boob Job
description: Debra thinks Ray would like her better if she had bigger boobs.

title: The Can Opener
description: Ray and Debra have a fight over a can opener.

title: You Bet
description: Frank uses Ray to win bets on sports.

title: Sex Talk
description: Marie and Frank talk about their sex life.

title: The Will
description: If Ray and Debra both pass away, they want Bernie and Linda to adopt the kids.

title: The Sister
description: Debra's sister Jennifer visits and announces her intention to become a nun.

title: Cousin Gerard
description: Ray's annoying cousin Gerard is hired by Marie to help him write his book. Ray's entire family starts to see that Ray has many of the same annoying traits as Gerard. Ray decides to work on Gerard while trying to make himself feel better.

title: Debra's Workout
description: Ray becomes jealous when he sees Debra's new aerobics instructor.

title: No Thanks
description: Debra tries a new approach to Maries negative attitude.

title: Left Back
description: Ray and Debra decide to have the twins stay back in Kindergarden for another year.

title: The Christmas Picture
description: Ray decides to take a family picture for Marie's Christmas present. But she didn't want Debra's family to be in it.

title: What's with Robert?
description: Marie begins to think that Robert is gay when he breaks up with Amy again.

title: Bully on the Bus
description: When Ray and Debra find out the a bully is picking on Ally, Ray decides to investigate.

title: Prodigal Son
description: Frank tells Ally that Ray is going to Hell because he doesn't go to church.

title: Robert's Rodeo
description: Robert gets gored in the rear by a bull and has to stay with Marie and Frank for a while.

title: The Tenth Anniversary
description: Ray accidentally tapes football over his wedding.

title: Hackidu
description: Ray tries to learn about Ally's favorite card game.

title: Debra Makes Something Good
description: For once, Debra makes a good meal, but it drives Marie crazy.

title: Marie and Frank's New Friends
description: Frank and Marie make friends with a couple that have similar personalities to their own.

title: Alone Time
description: Debra wants to be alone for a while. Ray wonders why.

title: Someone's Cranky
description: Robert is still recovering from his bull accident. He finds out he has to stay 3 more weeks with Frank & Marie before moving back to his apartment. He is cranky and taking it out on everyone. Debra tries to make his birthday festive.

title: Bad Moon Rising
description: It's that time of month for Debra and Ray walks on egg shells to avoid the mood swings. Encouraged by Robert, Frank, and fiends, Ray buys pills that are supposed to help her mood. Debra is not pleased.

title: Confronting the Attacker
description: Robert is back on the force and back with Amy. But something is still wrong.

title: Robert's Divorce
description: Flashback to when Robert got divorced.

title: Italy: Part 1
description: For Marie's birthday, the family goes to Italy. But Ray gets a cold and becomes miserable and Robert finds the woman of his dreams. But first he has to get past her father.

title: Italy: Part 2
description: The show continues in Italy. Ray starts to appreciate Italy and Robert must avoid Stefania's father if he wishes to see tomorrow.

title: The Wallpaper
description: Marie and Frank crash their car into Ray's house.

title: Meant to Be
description: Robert tells Amy about Stephonia because he thinks they're meant to be. Another breakup.

title: Pet Cemetery
description: Ally's hamster dies and she wants a proper funeral.

title: The Author
description: Ray tries to write a book but gets rejected. Robert makes lieutenant.

title: The Walk to the Door
description: At a wedding, Ray reunites with the first woman he dated. He tells the family about the time he didn't walk her to the door.

title: Young Girl
description: Robert's new girlfriend is way too young.

title: Fighting In-Laws
description: Debra's parents visit for Thanksgiving and confess that they're going to marriage counseling.

title: The Sneeze
description: A man accidentally sneezes on Ray and he think's he's caught the man's germs.

title: Christmas Present
description: Ray gets Debra a really great present for Christmas so she'll agree to let him go golfing.

title: What Good Are You?
description: Ray starts to have second thoughts about himself after he didn't help Debra when she was choking.

title: Super Bowl
description: Ray decides to take Gianni to the Super Bowl with him. But the rest of the family want's to go.

title: Ray's Journal
description: When Marie finds the diary that Ray kept as a boy, he is embarrassed about much of the sexual content, but she is only upset over a single mean comment about her.

title: Silent Partners
description: Ray and Debra can't think of anything to talk about. Debra thinks they need to spend more time together.

title: Fairies
description: The twins want to be fairies in the school play.

title: Stefania Arrives
description: Marie doesn't want Robert to end up alone, so she invites Stefania to America. But she comes with her father.

title: Humm Vac
description: Marie gives Debra a Humm Vac to help with the house. Debra loses her temper.

title: The Canister
description: Marie thinks Debra has her canister, but Debra says she doesn't. But when Debra finds it in Ally's room, she gets Ray and Robert to help her sneak it back into Marie's house.

title: Net Worth
description: Ray invests money in a go-cart venture without telling Deborah. He says it is his money, so Deborah bills him for the job she does with the children and the house. Robert compares it to a wrongful death lawsuit - the value of life.

title: Let's Fix Robert
description: Marie thinks somethings wrong with Robert. So she gathers all of the girls in Robert's life to come up with ways to help him.

title: Say Uncle
description: Ray thinks his kids like Robert better than him.

title: Separation
description: Debra finds it hard to handle her parents' divorce.

title: Frank Paints the House
description: Frank, Ray, and Robert paint Ray's house. And Robert and Ray find out something new about their father.

title: Ally's Birth
description: Flashback to when Ally was born.

title: The Angry Family
description: Michael writes a story about an angry family. Ray, Debra, and everyone else think it's about them.

title: No Roll!
description: Ray buys an erotic board game which he hopes will help rejuvenate Debra's amorous interests, but she suggests the problem is with him.

title: Odd Man Out
description: When Marco begins taking piano lessons from Marie and starts spending more time with her, Frank becomes jealous of their friendship.

title: Ray's Ring
description: Robert loses Ray's wedding ring and the women start hitting on Ray.

title: Marie's Sculpture
description: Marie makes a sculpture of something that looks inappropriate. But Ray can't find the strength to tell her.

title: Frank Goes Downstairs
description: Ray blabbers about his wrist hurting when he and Debra fell out of bed during sex. But when Frank hears about it, Ray pretends that it's because they fell down the stairs. While Frank is fixing the stairs, he falls into the basement and breaks his rib.

title: Jealous Robert
description: Marie and Debra put Amy and Gianni together to make Robert jealous.

title: It's Supposed to Be Fun
description: The twins are on a basketball team, but Jeffrey is not interested in playing and is easily distracted. Ray makes funny comments about his playing and Jeffrey quits the team. Ray talks to him and tells him it is OK either way.

title: Older Women
description: Debra's father brings an older woman to Thanksgiving dinner.

title: Raybert
description: Robert finds a date only because she thinks he's Ray.

title: The Kicker
description: Frank catches a historic field goal at a college football game. But instead of returning it to the school or the kicker, he holds it ransom for $10,000.

title: Season's Greetings
description: Marie writes a letter to include with her Christmas cards - it insults Debra and praises Marie. They decide to write a letter together. Raymond is heavily praised and Robert is not. Robert wants to include his own information.

title: Tissues
description: Angry that Debra seems to be making all the decisions, Ray decides to take charge of a few things around the house. He goes to the supermarket, but finds that his purchases are criticized by everyone in the family.

title: Snow Day
description: When it's stormy and the power's out, the family and Amy have to put up with each other till the storm's over.

title: Cookies
description: Ray finds a rival at Ally's girl scout meeting. They have a battle to see whose daughter can sell the most cookies.

title: Lucky Suit
description: When Robert get's a job offer with the FBI, Marie tries to stop him from being successful.

title: The Skit
description: For Lee and Stan's Anniversary Ray and Debra provide some entertainment by making fun of Marie and Frank.

title: The Breakup Tape
description: Debra finds a tape with a message from Ray's ex-girlfriend breaking up with him on it. Debra wonders why Ray has kept it all this time.

title: Talk to Your Daughter
description: Ally asks what the meaning of life is and no one knows how to answer her.

title: A Vote for Debra
description: Debra decides to run for school president. Ray panics, because this means he has to take more responsibilities around the house. He decides not to vote for her.

title: Call Me Mom
description: Ray started calling Debra's mom, so he tells Debra she should call Marie mom. She does, but Marie does not like it. Marie knows it is only because Ray calls Lois mom.

title: Mother's Day
description: Marie and Debra have a fight which could mean the end of their family relationship.

title: The Bigger Person
description: Ray and Frank are tired of trying to make their wives talk again. So instead they use them to get what they want.

title: The First Time
description: Flashback to the night Ray and Debra first had sex.

title: The First Six Years
description: An hour of the best moments of Everybody Loves Raymond's first six years. With interviews from celebrities about why they love the show and how they can relate to the characters.

title: The Cult
description: When Robert joins a cult, the Inner Path, Raymond points out their idiot cousin Gerard is already a member. Although Robert eventually sees through the group (particularly when he realises the leaders were really after Raymond, to be their spokesman), he allows himself to be the subject of a fake intervention, in order to stop Debra and Marie squabbling.

title: Counseling
description: Ray and Debra go to marriage counseling to workout their problems.

title: Homework
description: Ray believes that Ally's school is giving out too much homework.

title: Pet the Bunny
description: Ray writes a eulogy for Frank. He tells the story of how he saw Frank petting his bunny we he was a kid. Frank goes berserk.

title: Who Am I?
description: Debra & Raymond go out on Saturday, but to different places. Marie thinks they are having marital problems. Ray did not have fun with his friends. He goes with Debra to a book reading and does not enjoy that either.

title: Robert Needs Money
description: Robert needs money, so Ray and Debra give him some. But then, Robert decides to go to Las Vegas and gamble.

title: The Sigh
description: Whenever Debra sighs, Ray thinks it's because of him. So he decides to give Debra their bathroom and he'll share the kids' bathroom from now on. Debra accepts.

title: Annoying Kid
description: Ray and Debra's new friends have a son that hates Ray.

title: She's the One
description: Robert's new girlfriend is perfect. Pretty, smart, funny, nice, and sexy. But Ray finds out something: She eats flies. How can Ray make Robert believe him?

title: Marie's Vision
description: Now that Robert is back with Amy, the family turns to another problem. Marie's eyes. Her eye sight is getting worse, so Debra asks her to go get glasses. Not only do the glasses help Marie's eyes, but she starts seeing things that no one else can see.

title: The Thought That Counts
description: Ray lies to Debra about getting her a great Christmas present. He goes to Amy and Robert for help and Robert suggests the book "To Kill a Mockingbird". But when Ray gets all the credit, Robert snaps.

title: Grandpa Steals
description: When Ally witnesses Frank, stealing food from the supermarket, she starts avoiding him.

title: Somebody Hates Raymond
description: Andy's new boss hates Ray. Ray does everything he can to find out why.

title: Just a Formality
description: Robert decides that it's time to propose to Amy. But her parents say "no". So Ray and Robert try to make them change their minds.

title: The Disciplinarian
description: Ray finally finds out that, to the kids, he's a pushover. So he decides to go hard on them. But he may be going a little too hard.

title: Sweet Charity
description: Debra signs up for charity work and signs up Ray for an hour of charity at the hospital. He is reluctant but goes. Turns out the patients enjoy his humor and sports information and he enjoys going. Debra is upset at how often he is gone.

title: Meeting the Parents
description: Marie and Frank meet Hank and Pat for the first time.

title: The Plan
description: Ray and Frank persuade Robert to make a complete hash of designing his and Amy's wedding invitations, so that Amy will step in and take over; unfortunately, the plan backfires and the invitations go out, warts 'n' all. Worse, Debra realises Ray has been faking incompetence for years to avoid performing his household duties.

title: Sleepover at Peggy's
description: Ray reluctantly takes his daughter to her friend Molly's for a sleepover, fearing another run-in with Molly's mother, Peggy (previously seen in season six's "Cookies"). A casual pat on the behind leads Ray to believe Peggy is coming on to him.

title: Who's Next?
description: When a friend of Frank and Marie dies, Marie tells Frank that it had been the woman Marie had picked out to marry him if she died first; Ray and Debra then get into a debate about who they would choose to take their place if they died.

title: The Shower
description: When Debra has too much to drink at Amy's shower she rests in the car until she feels better. But the cops think that she was drinking and driving. Marie becomes even more protective.

title: Baggage
description: Ray and Debra have a three-week-fight over who's going to put the suitcase away.

title: The Bachelor Party
description: When Ray's bachelor party for Robert doesn't go well, Amy, Debra, and Marie tell him to try again.

title: Robert's Wedding
description: Robert and Amy finally get married. But it's not the wedding they expected.

title: Fun with Debra
description: When Debra sees that Ray is having fun with Michael and Geoffery, she wonders why Ray can't have that much fun with her.

title: Thank You Notes
description: Robert & Amy are back from their honeymoon. Marie immediately starts questioning when they are going to send out Thank You Notes from the wedding. Amy is surprised at Marie's insistence and Debra wants her to stand strong against Marie.

title: Home from School
description: Michael doesn't want to go to school and spends the day watching Ray work at his home office in the basement.

title: Misery Loves Company
description: Robert & Amy celebrate their 3-month anniversary and invite Ray, Debra, Marie, and Frank to dinner. Robert & Amy are in the throes of new love and give marriage advice to the others. New love is different from old love and a debate begins.

title: The Contractor
description: Debra asks Gianni to work on the stove, but all he does is watch "The Price is Right". Debra wants to fire him, but Ray tries to stop her.

title: Peter on the Couch
description: Peter stays with Amy and Robert for awhile. But when he goes back home he finds out that his parents are throwing him out. Now, where will Peter stay?

title: Liars
description: Ray makes up a lie to tell his mother why he didn't come over to her house for quality time.

title: The Surprise Party
description: Debra's mother, Lois, suggests to Raymond that she will throw a surprise birthday party for her daughter and Ray won't have to lift a finger. Debra senses something is afoot and Ray spills the beans, but Debra wants a Chinese banquet instead. Ray tries to convince his mother-in-law to change the theme of the party, never disclosing to her or to anyone that it's no surprise - Debra knows all about it. Inevitably, all is revealed when Debra arrives home to a houseful of guests and embarrasses herself, her husband and disappoints her mother, who wanted, more than anything, to surprise her daughter.

title: The Bird
description: The family spends Thanksgiving with Amy's parents. They seem to get along pretty well, at first, but when a bird hits the house and Pat kills it, it becomes a war.

title: Jazz Records
description: When the twins ruin Ray's dictionary Frank brings up how Ray ruined his jazz records. Ray tries to give his father CDs instead of records for Christmas.

title: Debra at the Lodge
description: Frank's Lodge is losing members and is only open 4 days a week much to Marie's dismay! Frank is driving Marie crazy by being home so much. Debra was offering advice on "recruitment strategies" about how they could get more members to join and liven up the place! Since Debra used to work in PR (Public Relations), Frank and his lodge buddies offer Debra a job as co-ordinator and they offer to pay her to help get the Lodge back on it's feet. Needless to say things go awry when Frank's "disgusting lodge buddies" (as Marie would put it) were making sexy comments start about Debra's good looks behind her back to eachother and in front of Frank. The wives of the lodge fellas also had complaints because their husbands would come home all peppy and expecting them to be as hot and good looking as Debra. You can pretty much guess where this all goes. I must say it brings out one of Frank's most tender sides! I'd say it's in Frank's top 5 tender moments of all time of all episodes. Frank's sensitivity and love for Debra really shines in this episode.

title: Slave
description: Ray and Debra both leave the twins at home alone. When they figure this out they hurry home and find Ally taking care of them. When they see this, Debra decides to give Ally more responsibilities. A lot more.

title: Whose Side Are You On?
description: Debra and the children bet against Raymond all the time. He is upset when he finds out because they make fun of him. Then he remembers that Marie used to do things like that with he and Robert about their father when they were young.

title: Lateness
description: Ray is getting tired of Debra making him wait for her. They're late for everything. So he decides to set a time, and if Debra isn't ready by that time, he's leaving without her. Which may be the last thing he'll ever do.

title: Party Dress
description: Peggy's daughter is having a birthday party and Ally is invited. But she has to wear a dress and Ray doesn't want to spend all of that money.

title: Security
description: Robert installs a security alarm in Ray's house because he's thinking about retiring from the force and becoming an alarm salesman. But he wants everyone's opinion first.

title: The Ingrate
description: Ray's old college is giving him an honorary doctorate degree, and everyone starts fighting over who should get the most credit.

title: Crazy Chin
description: Hank and Pat ask Robert why he keeps touching his food to his chin before he eats it. Now the whole family is curious. Why does he do it?

title: The Nice Talk
description: Hank and Pat come up for Easter. Ray and Pat have a nice time talking with each other, which make Robert and Debra jealous.

title: Blabbermouths
description: Debra talks to the girls about how some of the cute things that Ray does, but Ray finds it embarrassing. So he talks to Frank and Robert about Debra's flaws. Then secrets start coming out.

title: The Model
description: A modeling agent spots Robert and signs him up for a career. The family is really excited for him. But when he and Ray go to get his pictures from his first shoot, they find out that it was a conned job. So Ray and Robert try to make up an excuse to tell the rest of the family.

title: The Mentor
description: A stranger shows up one day to see Frank. But Frank knows the man. It turns out that the stranger used to work with Frank at the company when he was growing up. Frank taught him everything he knew. When Ray and Robert hear this, they get jealous. Why wasn't Frank nice to them when they were growing up?

title: Golf for It
description: Marie wants the boys to paint her new shelf. But the boys want to go golfing. They start to feel guilty when they leave and start talking about how much they love her. So they decide to golf to see who'll get Marie when Frank dies.

title: The Home
description: Marie and Frank decide to move.

title: Not So Fast
description: As soon as Marie and Frank move into they're new house, their neighbors want them to leave. So they move back into their old house with Robert and Amy.

title: Angry Sex
description: Ray plans an evening of sex. But Marie makes Debra lose her temper and she's not in the mood anymore. Ray tries his best to put her back in the mood. Which leads to the best night of sex he's ever had. But when Marie comes over to apologize, Ray lies to them both to make Debra's rage bigger.

title: P.T. & A.
description: Debra complains about how Ray dresses for the PTA meetings and Ray makes up a lie that the other women at the PTA say Debra dresses "trampy". Hurt by this, Debra decides to have revenge on the PTA.

title: Ally's F
description: Ally gets an "F" in Math. Debra wonders why, so she goes to the school to talk to the teacher, and it turns out that Ally has a crush on one the boys in the class.

title: Boys' Therapy
description: Debra, Amy, and Marie want their husbands to have therapy. But in secret, the boys actually go to gamble at the track.

title: Debra's Parents
description: Ray walks in on Debra's parents having sex and tells Debra. Which leads Debra to think that her parents are getting back together.

title: A Job for Robert
description: Marie has been treating Robert better for some reason. Making sure he and Amy are well relaxed and spend a lot of time together. Ray finds out it's because she wants "grandchildren".

title: A Date for Peter
description: Debra has a singles cocktail party to help Amy's lonely brother Peter,find a girlfriend but Ray is mortified by who he ends up attracted too.

title: Favors
description: Debra accidentally throws out Ray's letter from Muhammad Ali and Marie takes the blame for it. But in return for helping Debra, Marie has Debra take the blame for the disappearance of Franks clothes. Debra can't lie very well so she tells Frank the truth and tells him not to tell Marie. In return Franks wants her to take the blame for digging up Marie's roses. It becomes one big mess!

title: The Faux Pas
description: The twins' new friend has a janitor for a father. When Ray accidentally says a bad joke in front of the father he tries to cheer him up, but keeps making things worse.

title: Tasteless Frank
description: Frank has been secretly taking pills to help his "manhood". But the side effect is: He's lost his sense of taste.

title: Sister-In-Law
description: Amy wants to feel closer to Ray. But Ray finds it annoying.

title: The Power of No
description: For once, Debra wants sex. But Ray rejects her so she can feel how he feels when she rejects him. But when Debra finds out, it's war.

title: Pat's Secret
description: Amy's parents visit for Easter. Robert finds out something about his mother-in-law that no one else knows about and tries to keep her secret.

title: The Finale
description: Ray undergoes a routine surgery. The medical personnel have difficulty waking him for a while causing most of the family to panic. Ray finally wakes up, and everyone is a little nicer to him after wards.
